material.mattext: Which of the following best defines a Mobile Ad hoc Network (MANET)?
A network of fixed infrastructure nodes connected through wired links
A network of mobile devices that communicate without a fixed infrastructure
A network of satellites communicating with ground stations
A network of cellular base stations connecting mobile devices
What is the primary advantage of a MANET?
Which routing protocol is commonly used in MANETs?
What is the main challenge in MANET routing due to node mobility?
Which of the following is a key characteristic of Cognitive Radio (CR)?
What is the primary goal of Cognitive Radio technology?
Which technology enables Cognitive Radio to sense and detect spectrum availability?
Which spectrum sharing policy allows Cognitive Radio devices to use spectrum bands if they are not occupied by primary users?
What is the primary advantage of Cognitive Radio in terms of spectrum efficiency?
Which technology enables Cognitive Radio devices to adapt their transmission parameters based on the current channel conditions?
What is the main challenge in Cognitive Radio networks related to interference management?
Which network topology is commonly found in MANETs?
What is the primary advantage of a mesh topology in MANETs?
Which of the following is a challenge in MANET routing due to limited network resources?
Which of the following is a challenge in Cognitive Radio networks related to spectrum sensing?
Which protocol is commonly used for medium access control in MANETs?
Carrier Sense Multiple Access with Collision Avoidance (CSMA/CA)
